column3: Fallohide]] stock. He was the brother of [[Blanco]].

column2: 1601}}, Marcho and his the brother [[Blanco]] led a group of mostly [[Harfoots
column3: Harfoot]] [[hobbits]] westwards from [[Bree]]. They crossed [[Baranduin]] and with the permission of [[King of Arthedain
column4: King]] [[Argeleb II]] they settled in the royal hunting grounds of [[Arthedain]] and founded [[the Shire]]. Soon after (c. {{TA
column5: 1630}}), [[Stoors]] from [[Dunland]] came to this new land.<ref>{{FR

column1: [[Old English]] and Celtic ''marka'' is an element that refers to "horse" (see ''[[mearas]]'').
The two brothers are perhaps based on [[Wikipedia:Hengest
column3: Horsa]], who brought the Saxons to Britany.<ref>[[Jim Allan]], ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "An etymological excursion among the Shire Folk"</ref>
